DataElement.preferredName: Second Bridge Therapy Administered Begin Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The second bridge therapy start date

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: _Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude._Therapy intended to transition a patient from one therapy or medication to another or maintain their health or status until they are a candidate for a therapy or have decided on a therapy._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test):Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Therapy intended to transition a patient from one therapy or medication to another or maintain their health or status until they are a candidate for a therapy or have decided on a therapy.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Property.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.
